item.title: Japanese Emblems & UI Design
item.description:
Japanese Emblems & UI Design

Some of the interesting things you tend to notice while living in Japan is the predominance of monshou (紋章) everywhere around you, whether it’s in art, media, architecture, and even everyday objects. It could be an advertisement in a train station or the cover of a book you’re flipping through, the predominance of iconic family seals is a treat for people who enjoy artistic flair in their everyday routine.

item.title: Eric @QuestionModern
item.description:
Eric @QuestionModern

Replay of the livestream I did at Marshall Beach. Relax while thinking about the meaning of life, the universe, and everything.

item.title: Yamanashi Travelogue
item.description:
Yamanashi Travelogue

I was going through my photos and found these pictures that I took during my trip to Yamanashi Prefecture. I took several, but the quality of most was questionable, but I picked out these which were my favorites. I recommend you look at these pictures as you read through my previous post. I consider it a photographic continuation to the ending of that post.

item.title: Weekend in The Mountains
item.description:
Weekend in The Mountains

“The bleakness I saw the night before turned out to be beautiful ordinary life that was only hidden in plain sight.” A short narrative of one of my most memorable trips in Japan.

Gif Image by Toyoi Yuuta

item.title: Golden Gate Scenery
item.description:
Golden Gate Scenery

Took these pictures in a cold San Francisco afternoon. It was a somber day full of beauty and roaring winds. I also took the opportunity to do an impromptu livestream of the scenery. I enjoyed reading the flurry of comments from people around the globe admiring the view and finding the sound of the waves relaxing.

item.title: Things no one will tell you about grad school
item.description:
Things no one will tell you about grad school

Whether you’re thinking about pursuing an advanced degree or are already a student yourself, you will most likely encounter two versions of the nature of graduate school, especially if you’re a liberal arts student.
